measured_by: choice between CBR option and rule option in 13 realistic historical moral dilemmas
justification: "We showed participants and LLMs 13 moral dilemmas [31,42] between the 'CBR option' ... and the 'rule option'," indicating these dilemmas serve as the instrument for assessing which moral choice people make.

measured_by: Yes↔No Reframing versions of six moral dilemmas
justification: "To test for the yes-no bias, we reframed the question so that the 'yes' response now corresponded to the previous 'no' response (Yes↔No Reframing)." This reframed set functions as the measure of the bias.

measured_by: Action↔Omission Reframing versions of six moral dilemmas
justification: "To test for omission bias, we changed whether the action coincided with the CBR option. In the Action↔Omission Reframing we…"—the altered dilemmas operationalize omission bias.

measured_by: normalized altruism score derived from slider responses to nine collective action problems
justification: "We calculated an altruism score that normalizes the responses for each dilemma… where 0 denotes the most selfish response … and 1 the most altruistic," showing this score from the collective action vignettes is the measure of altruism.
